messages.Account.AgeConfirm: I am 13 years of age or older
messages.Account.ResetPasswordInstructions: A recovery code has been sent to your email. Copy it to the field below:
messages.Account.RegistrationSuccess:
Success!

An email has been sent to {email} with a verification link.

Once you click on this link, we'll automatically log you in as long as this dialog is open.

If you run into problems, reach us at hello@neos.com or discord.gg/neosvr
messages.Account.TOTP.Initializing: Checking status of 2FA for your account...
messages.Account.TOTP.Code.Description:
First you need to input a secret code to your TOTP authentication app such as Authy or Google Authenticator.

We recommend doing this by scanning the QR code, but alternatively you can manually input the secret code. Never share this code with anyone.

If you're in VR you can switch to desktop by pressing F8.
messages.Account.TOTP.RecoveryCodes.Description: Save these codes in a secure location. They can be used to recover access to your account in case you lose or damage your phone. Each code can be used only once. Never share them with anyone. If you lose them, you will PERMANENTLY lose access to your account.
messages.Account.TOTP.Activate.Description:
In order to activate the 2FA on your account, use the 6-digit token generated by your authenticator app to ensure that everything is working correctly.

Once activated, you'll need to use the code to confirm certain operations.

Note: Currently the code is only used for NCR transactions, but this will be expanded to account login in the future.
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.AlreadySetup: 2FA has already been setup on your account!
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.Error: Unexpected error! Please try again later.
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.SetupComplete:
Congratulations!

Your account is now setup with 2FA for extra protection!

Currently any NCR interactions will require you to input your code. You can optionally enable this for account login with /enableLogin2FA command, but note this requires you to use /webLogin command before you login on account.neos.com
messages.Account.TOTP.Deactivate.Description:
2FA is currently setup and active on your account. If you need to deactivate it (e.g. due to loss of your phone or the codes being compromised), you can do so here.

After deactivation, you can setup 2FA again, which will generate a brand new secret code and new set of recovery codes.

If you lose your phone and need to setup 2FA again, we STRONGLY advise you do so immediatelly, as each recovery code can be used only once and after you run out you'll be completely locked out of your account.
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.DeactivationComplet:
2FA has been successfully deactivated on your account.

Your account is now at increased risk!

We strongly recommend setting up 2FA again immediatelly, especially if you used a recovery code due to losing your phone.
messages.Permissions.NotAllowedToSpawn: You are not allowed to spawn things here.
messages.Permissions.NotAllowedToSave: You are not allowed to save items in this world.
messages.Permissions.NotAllowedToSwapAvatar: You are not allowed to swap to custom avatar here.

messages.NewWorld.Title: New World
messages.FullBody.Title: Full Body / Avatar Calibration
messages.FullBody.HeightInstructions: Make sure this is your actual height, otherwise calibration won't work correctly. The mannequin should fit the headset and controllers.
messages.FullBody.HeightWarning: This seems incorrect. Make sure it's your actual height.
messages.FullBody.MappingInstructions: Stand in upright position and ensure the trackers are tracking and detected correctly.
messages.FullBody.JustCalibrateAvatarDescription: Skip full body calibration and just calibrate the avatar
messages.FullBody.CalibrateInstructions: Align yourself with the the red body overlay in your playspace and press both triggers to confirm. Make sure your real feet and hips match the virtual ones as close as possible.
messages.FullBody.BeforeCalibrationInstructions: Make sure trackers are tracking and your height is set
messages.FullBody.CalibratingPoseInstructions: Align yourself with the reference and press both triggers to confirm
messages.FullBody.AdjustAvatarInstructions: Adjust avatar body offsets to best match the reference
messages.FullBody.FineTuneCalibrationInstructions: Verify and fine tune calibration by moving blue references
messages.FullBody.CalibrateTrackersInstructions:
Grab and position the blue body parts relative to the trackers to adjust their offset. They should match the location of the tracker on your body.
You can adjust calibration anytime later by reopening this tool.
messages.FullBody.HeightCompensationInstructions: If the mannequin is too tall (hunched) or too short, adjust the height compensation for best fit.
messages.FullBody.CalibrateAvatarInstructions: Make sure all body parts are mapped and then drag the blue spheres around, to make the avatar best match the body reference.
messages.FullBody.AvatarHeightCompensationInstruc: If the avatar is too tall (ends up hunched up) or too short for you, adjust its height compensation here so it better fits your height.
messages.FullBody.AvatarSaveWarning: Don't forget to save your avatar after you're finished calibrating it!
messages.FullBody.CalibrationFinishedInstructions: If you're satisfied with the calibration, you can save your avatar now and exit.
messages.FullBody.CalibrationRedoInstructions:
If the calibration is off or you want to calibrate more avatars you can make more adjustments. You can also reopen this calibrator any time in the future to make adjustments.
If you've only changed your trackers, you don't need to calibrate your avatars again.
messages.CameraControl.Title: Camera Control
messages.CameraControl.Anchors.NoAnchors: No camera anchors in this world
messages.CameraControl.OBS.Instructions: Make sure that OBS is running and has the obs-websocket plugin installed
messages.CameraControl.OBS.ConnectionTimeout: Connection timeout. Is OBS running with websocket plugin installed?

messages.Inspector.CharacterController.Warning:
WARNING!
It is possible to use this component as a simple rigidbody by checking SimulateRotation. Before you do, please understand that it is not optimized for this purpose and proper Rigidbody Support is coming in the future.
Proper rigidbody support will offer:
- CPU and network efficiency - with CharacterController you'll be getting higher CPU usage and significant amount of network traffic
- Constraints - you'll be able to create joints, hinges, springs and other constraints between rigidbodies
- Smooth simulation and interactions for everyone - CharacterController will glitch out if another person tries to interact
- New Features and Tools - to make using them much easier
-----------------------
You can find more at GitHub issue #22. As long as you understand those limitations, have fun!
messages.Wizard.AssetOptimization.Title: Asset Optimization Wizard
messages.Wizard.LightSources.Title: Light Sources Wizard
messages.Wizard.CubemapCreator.Title: Cubemap Creator
messages.Wizard.CubemapCreator.TexturesNote: Note that some conventions have left and right swapped. If the resulting cubemap is incorrect, try swapping the left and right textures.
messages.Wizard.ReflectionProbes.Title: Reflection Probe Wizard
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.ScreenWarning:
WARNING: You are currently playing in screen mode, which isn't currently officially supported and is primarily designed for debugging.

While it can be used to play, some things won't work and controls might be difficult to use.

Neos is currently meant to be played in VR.

A proper desktop mode is planned to be implemented in the future.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.AccountDescription: Creating an Account gives you 1 GB free storage and access to saving items, favoriting avatars, adding contacts and messaging.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.AccountSkipDescription: Some functionality like saving items to inventory, favoriting avatar or adding contacts won't be accessible.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsDescription: You can configure basic motion and user preferences. All of these can be changed at later point.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsSnapTurnDescrip: Instantly snaps to new angle, ideal for new users
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsSmoothTurnDescr: Gradually turns, but can cause nausea.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.StartTutorialDescriptio: We'll transfer you to a basic tutorial world to help you get started with Neos. You can choose to have the tutorial world public, allowing Neos community to join and help you, or learn on your own.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.StartTutorialPublic: I want people to be able to join and help me
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.PrivateTutorialDescript: Community members can help you get set up easier and faster, really proceed alone?
messages.Tutorial.Intro.WelcomeDescription: Your guide to experiencing the metaverse.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.GrabbingVR:
Pick up near objects by Grabbing with the Gripbutton.
To pick up far objects, first press Trigger to toggle your laser, then Grab the object with the Grip button.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.GrabbingScreen: Pick up objects by Grabbing with the Right Mouse button.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.ScalingVR: To Scale an object, grab it with both hands and move them closer or further apart - this can also be done with your lasers.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.ScalingScreen: To Scale an object, grab it with Right Mouse button. While holding down Shift scroll with your Scroll Wheel.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.ContextMenuDescription:
Your Context Menu provides quick actions.
Open or close it using the {button}.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.DestroyingDuplicatingVR: While holding an object, Destroy or Duplicate it by Clicking the action in the context menu.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.DestroyingDuplicatingScre: While holding an object, Destroy it with the action in the Context Menu or by pressing the Delete key. Duplicate it with the action in the Context Menu.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.ScalingYourselfVR: To Scale Yourself, enable scaling in your context menu, then hold both Grip Buttons and move your hands closer or further apart.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.ScalingYourselfScreen: To Scale Yourself Open the Context Menu and Enable Scaling then hold Ctrl and scroll your Scroll wheel.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.LocomotionDescription:
Neos contains many different methods of movement.
These locomotion options are available within your Context Menu.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.DashboardDescription:
The Dashboard is your main menu.
You open and close it using the {button}.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.DashboardDescriptionCircl:
The Dashboard is your main menu.
You open and close it by holding the {button} until the circle is full, then release.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.InventoryVR:
Your Inventory is located on your Dashboard.
To Spawn an object, Double-Click the item in your inventory.
To Save an object, hold the item and press on the top right corner.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.InventoryScreen:
Your Inventory is located on your Neos Dashboard.
To spawn an object, Double-Click the item in your inventory.
To save an object, hold the item and save through the Context Menu.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.HomeScreenDescription:
Your Home Screen contains facets with many features.
These include the Avatar Creator, Full body Calibrator, Camera/Streaming, and Create New World.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.ContactsDescription:
Your Contacts are located on the Dashboard.
Send messages, voice messages, or objects to contacts with the chatbox on the bottom right.
Add contacts with the search bar, found in the top left corner.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.FilesDescription:
Import files, 3D models, images, audio, videos, or fonts directly into Neos!
Either drag and drop files onto the Neos window, or find them using the File Browser.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.SessionDescription: Session settings, permission levels, and settings dealing with other users in the world can be found in the Session panel.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.SettingsDescription: Height, volume, comfort settings, language choice, and more are adjusted in the Settings tab.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.WorldsDescription:
Explore the metaverse using the Worlds menu.
When you're done here, join an active session to meet the community!
messages.Tutorial.Intro.OutroTop:
Further tutorials are available throughout this world.

Good luck and enjoy the metaverse!
messages.Tutorial.Intro.OutroEnd:
To support the project, join our Patreon.

Join the Discord for status updates, networking, or technical support.
messages.Tutorial.Grab.Scale: Grab with other controller to scale
messages.Tutorial.Grab.ContextEquip: Use Context Menu to Equip or Access Options
messages.Tutorial.WorldOrb.Info: World Orb Represents a world or a session Double Click - Enter Single Click - Context Menu
messages.Tutorial.Tooltip.ContextMenu: Access tool menu and dequip option
messages.Tutorial.Tooltip.MaterialPrimary:
Apply Material
<size=75%>(Place material orb into the gun)</size>
messages.Tutorial.Tooltip.MaterialSecondary:
Extract Material
<size=75%>(Ensure there's no material orb first)</size>
messages.Tutorial.Tooltip.WigglerPrimary: Unleash Unspoken Evils Upon The World
messages.Tutorial.BotDesigner.Intro.Title: Neos Bot Designer
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.Intro.Title: Neos Avatars
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.Intro.Descriptio: Learn how to find and use avatars!
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.Avatars.Title: Avatars
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.AvatarWorlds.Des: Select an avatar world you want to go to and click <color=#77ff77>Open World</color>.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.Avatars.Descript:
Avatars are a way to express yourself.
You can find or create avatars within the metaverse.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.FindingAvatars.D:
Common avatars are located in the
Neos Essentials folder in your inventory.

Community-made avatars can be found in public folders or published worlds.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.EquippingAndFavo:
Once you have an avatar, equip it by clicking
on it and choosing Equip Avatar.

Save your currently equipped avatar by clicking .

You can favorite your avatar by selecting it in your
inventory and clicking .
messages.Tutorial.AvatarTutorial.AvatarCreation.D:
To import and setup a custom avatar, refer to
the Neos Avatar Creation tutorial.
messages.Tutorial.Intro.PublicFolders.Title: Public Folders
messages.Tutorial.Intro.PublicFolders.Description:
Public Folders are an easy way for users in the Community to share and update their Creations like Avatars.

To save, grab the folder, then while holding press in your Inventory.

You can also save with your Context Menu.

Try it with The Starter Pack. A folder designed for new users.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.Intro.Title: Neos Avatar Creation
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.Intro.Description: Learn how to import your avatar and set it up!
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.ImportingAssets.D: Custom avatar assets, including the model, textures, normal maps, and more can all be imported directly from the in-app file browser, or by dragging and dropping the files onto the Neos window from your desktop.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.AvatarCreator.Des: After importing the model, open the Avatar Creator on the dashboard and place the head, hands, and tool anchors as prefered.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.SettingUpMaterial:
Using the Developer Tooltip press Secondary to select
the avatar and open its hierarchy.
Navigate to the avatar's root, and with the Material Tooltip equipped, Grab the CenteredRoot slot and press Secondary to extract the avatar's materials.
Textures and maps that haven't imported directly on the avatar can be added by editing the material, gripping the texture, and clicking on the target field.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.DynamicBones.Desc:
Dynamic bones can add life and interactivity to an otherwise static rig.
Add the DynamicBoneChain component to the start of the target bone chain, scroll to the bottom and click Setup from Children (Rig Only). This creates a default dynamic bone chain. You can edit its properties using the inspector.
After you have finished the initial setup, equip the avatar and navigate to a folder created in your inventory you wish to save it to, then press .

Click on your avatar in the inventory to select it, and press to set it as the favorite avatar.
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.Outro.Title: More Information & Help
messages.Tutorial.AvatarCreator.Outro.Description: Additional resources for avatar creation, set-up, and other tutorial content can be found on the community-run wiki, the Neos Discord, and on YouTube.
messages.Tutorial.CommunityYouTube.Title: Community YouTube Channels
messages.Tutorial.Intro.BadgesDescription: Badges are small icons which show aspects of a user. Here are a few important badges to remember. The disability badges can be self assigned though the Neos bot. For more information please check the Neos Wiki
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Microphone.Title: Microphone Tool
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Microphone.UsageDescr: Once the MICROPHONE TIP is equipped audio can be recorded by holding the PRIMARY button.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Microphone.AudioTypeD: Select the AUDIO FILE TYPE you want to use by opening the CONTEXT MENU on the tools equiped hand.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Microphone.RecordingD: You can change the RECORDING method using the options in the CONTEXT MENU.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Microphone.RawDescrip: The AUDIO OUTPUT method can be changed to RAW AUDIO format in the CONTEXT MENU.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.AudioStreaming.Title: Audio Streaming
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.AudioStreaming.Stream: Desktop audio can be streamed into Neos for others to hear. To stream audio, click STREAM AUDIO button on your dashboard homepage.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.AudioStreaming.StartS: Choose a device you would like to stream from the AUDIO INPUT list. The input chosen can be previewed in this panel before you begin streaming. Click START STREAMING to open an audio streaming panel.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.AudioStreaming.StopSt: The AUDIO STREAMING PANEL allows others in the session to hear audio from your computer. Closing the panel STOPS the stream.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Resolution.Pag: Under you can find multiple options to change the RESOLUTION of the images the CAMERA takes.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.BasicFunctions: You can SPAWN a CAMERA from the NEOS ESSENTIALS FOLDER within your INVENTORY. This is your main tool for CAPTURING images in Neos.
You can CAPTURE images using your PRIMARY on the BUTTON on top of the CAMERA or by GRABBING it anywhere on the CAMERA BODY and using your PRIMARY.
The ZOOM function can be found under . You can interact with the ZOOM SLIDER using PHYSICAL INTERACTION or by using your LASERS and PRIMARY.
You can also control the ZOOM amount by GRABBING the CAMERA LENS with your free hand and TWISTING the CAMERA LENS in a physical motion.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Mode.Page1.Des: BASIC SETTINGS can be found under By default the CAMERA is set to STANDARD PHOTO, which is the most commonly used CAMERA setting to CAPTURE images.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Mode.Page2.Des: The 3D PHOTO setting allows you to CAPTURE images that have an illusion of depth to them, which is achieved by creating a stereoscopic image. Note that this effect is only viewable with a headset and that the SCREENSHOT saved will appear as two images combined side by side in a single file.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Mode.Page3.Des: The 360 PHOTO setting allows the CAPTURE of EQUIRECTANGULAR 360 IMAGES that can be used in a PROJECTION360 MATERIAL, for use as a SKYBOX.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Mode.Page4.Des: The CUTOUT PHOTO setting allows the CAPTURE of a CUTOUT IMAGE. The CAMERA projects a LASER from the front that renders only the OBJECT it intersects with onto a transparent background, which is spawned as a SAVEABLE ITEM and SCREENSHOT.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.ImageFilters.P: CAMERA FILTERS can be found under . As standard, the CAMERA is set to the DEFAULT filter.
The SATURATED filter increases the saturation level of colors along with increasing the contrast of light and dark values.
The GREYSCALE filter removes all saturation from colors.
The SEPIA filter removes all saturation from colors and hue shifts them to emulate the look of tintype photographs.
The RAINBOW filter can be used to add some color to your photos.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.OptionsPlus.Pa: ADVANCED SETTINGS can be found under . By default none of these are active. FRUSTUM is the first in the column, it creates a VISUAL which is the area that will be shown in the PREVIEW SCREEN of the CAMERA.

The TIMER option can be ACTIVATED with . It creates a 10 second countdown timer which starts when you CAPTURE an image by using your PRIMARY on the BUTTON on top of the CAMERA, or while GRABBING the CAMERA BODY and pressing PRIMARY.
The SCREENSPACE REFLECTIONS option enables reflections based off of the viewport of the CAMERA.
The FLASH option can be ACTIVATED with . This EXTENDS a LIGHT out of top of the CAMERA BODY that ILLUMINATES the SCENE.

The BIG SCREEN option can be ACTIVATED with . It creates a larger PREVIEW SCREEN above the CAMERA BODY. It can also be activated by using your PRIMARY or PHYSICAL TOUCH on the center top BUTTON of the CAMERA BODY.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.ExcludeTip.Pag: The CAMERA OBJECT EXCLUDE TIP can be located in your INVENTORY under ESSENTIAL TOOLS --> MISC.
Once the tool is equipped AIM at the object you wish to exclude from the cameras view and press SECONDARY. PRIMARY to revert the change.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Mode.Title: Mode
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Intro.Title: Physical Camera Tutorial
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.Camera.Intro.Descript: Learn all the functions of the physical camera
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.LightTip.Intro.Title: Light Tip Tutorial
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.LightTip.Intro.Descri: Learn all the functions of the light tip
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.LightTip.BasicUsage.P: You can SPAWN a LIGHT TIP from the ESSENTIAL TOOLS folder within your INVENTORY. This is your main tool for ADDING LIGHTS to worlds in Neos.
By default the LIGHT TIP creates a POINT LIGHT when PRIMARY is used. When PRIMARY is held and dragged, the BRIGHTNESS of the light is affected based on the DISTANCE the hand is DRAGGED.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.LightTip.TypesOfLight: The POINT LIGHT creates a light that ILLUMINATES every direction from a single point with INTENSITY FALLOFF.
The SPOT LIGHT creates a light that ILLUMINATES in one direction as a cone from a single point with INTENSITY FALLOFF.
The DIRECTIONAL LIGHT creates a light that ILLUMINATES the world in one direction with no INTENSITY FALLOFF.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.LightTip.TypesOfShado: OBJECTS will cast shadows with hard edges.
OBJECTS will cast shadows with soft edges.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.LightTip.ChangingColo: You can change the COLOR of the LIGHT using the CHANGE COLOR option in the CONTEXT MENU.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.StreamCamera.CameraAn: To SPAWN a CAMERA ANCHOR press the CREATE CAMERA ANCHOR button on the left of your UI. Once created you can snap your camera to it by selecting it with PRIMARY.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.StreamCamera.BasicFun: You can SPAWN a CAMERA CONTROL PANEL from the NEOS DASHBOARD on the home tab under a facet called Camera/Streaming. This is your main tool for streaming content from Neos.

The CAMERA CONTROL PANEL has many different functions that can be used to improve the quality of your streams/video recording. These functions include camera movement, modes, anchors, settings, Twitch chat and more.

The CAMERA CONTROL PANEL movement function can be located at the top left corner of the preview screen. Using this you will be able to adjust the cameras view and position. Additionally you can click the Reset button to reset the position of the camera.
To control the ZOOM, use PRIMARY on the grey bar at the bottom of the preview screen and move the slider left or right.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.StreamCamera.Modes.Pa: SMOOTH POV set the camera to your first person view and smooths any movement.
THIRD PERSON mode allows you to view yourself from an outside perspecive. You can adjust the cameras position using the camera movement controls on the preview screen.
GROUP mode automatically adjusts its view to keep nearby users in view.
WORLD mode keeps the camera stationary and tracks the user.
MANUAL mode allows you to use the streaming camera like the physical camera.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.StreamCamera.Function: MIRROR TO DISPLAY changes your desktop from your vr headset to the streaming camera view, this option should be used if streaming or recording.
PHOTO takes a picture of the cameras current view. These photos get saved to your screenshot library.
360 PHOTO takes a 360 picture of the scene from the cameras current position. These photos get saved to your screenshot library.
USERS allows you to change the cameras view to another users perspecive as well as modify the volume and camera permissions for each person.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.StreamCamera.Intro.De: Learn all the functions of the streaming camera
CONTROL OPTIONS can be found on the far left of the UI, here you can change settings similar to the physical camera as well as nameplate rendering and more.
messages.Tutorial.Streaming.StreamCamera.Features: Extra camera control options can be found on the far right of the UI by pressing the GEAR icon on the top right of the preview screen. Here you can change render settings, user control, and follow distances.
The ARROW icon opens a panel to control the cameras motion. This can include position, angle, and FOV of the camera for the different preset viewpoints.
The WAYPOINT icon opens a panel to control different camera anchors. This is useful for changing to different anchors set in the world as well as the speed of interpolation.
The OBS icon opens a panel to connect to OBS. This can allow you to quickly start recording using OBS.
The TWITCH icon allows you to see your Twitch chat. You can link your channel by typing the channels name in the top left bar.

messages.Earthenworks.MentorSignal.Title.Offline:
Feeling Lost?
Ask in the Discord for help
messages.Earthenworks.MentorSignal.Title.Respondi: A Mentor Is On The Way
messages.Earthenworks.MentorSignal.Description.Re: Mentors are volunteers, you may be contacted later if the ticket doesn't get answered at this time.{2}{3}{4}
<color=#88ff88><noparse={1}>{0}</color> has claimed the ticket, soon they should either join the world, or contact you through the Contacts list.{2}{3}{4}
messages.Earthenworks.MentorSignal.Description.Ca: If you still need help, please reach out to the Discord or in public worlds. You may be contacted later to see if you still need assistance.
messages.Earthenworks.MentorSignal.Description.Co: Feel free to create another ticket if required, or ask for help on the Discord. The community is often happy to help!
This panel has lost connection with the mentor service: The panel will attempt to reconnect automatically. Check to ensure the connection is not blocked in Dashboard -> Home -> Debug -> Web Hosts. If all else fails, please cancel and re-create the ticket.
If this problem persists please let us known on the Discord.
The world is currently full: Ask the host to raise the player limit, invite the mentor directly, or coordinate with the mentor to find a work world.
The world is not publically accessible: For the mentor to join without an direct invitation the world must be Registered or Anyone, and must not be hidden from the session list.
If you need privacy: Contact the mentor through the Contacts list so they can be invited directly.
